definitions.definition: A song, or short musical composition.
The act of tuning or maintenance.
definitions.example: Your engine needs a good tune.

definitions.definition: The state or condition of being correctly tuned.
definitions.example: This piano is not in tune.

definitions.definition: A sound; a note; a tone.
To adjust (a musical instrument) so that it produces the correct pitches.
definitions.example: to tune a piano or a violin

definitions.definition: To adjust or modify (esp. a mechanical or electrical device) so that it functions optimally.
definitions.example: Tune your mind, and anything becomes possible.

definitions.definition: To adjust the frequency on a radio or TV set, so as to receive the desired channel.
definitions.example: Tune to Channel 6 for all your favourite daytime shows.

definitions.definition: (e.g. of senses or faculties) To adapt to or direct towards a particular target.
definitions.example: My ears were tuned to the sounds of the forest.

definitions.definition: To make more precise, intense, or effective; to put into a proper state or disposition.
To attune; to adapt in style of music; to make harmonious.
To give a certain tone or character to.
To sing with melody or harmony.
To cheek; to be impudent towards.
Used to show appreciation or approval of a song.
definitions.example: You heard the new Rizzle Kicks song? — Tune!
